Description: Rim sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; glaze fired red-brown; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below; top of lip glazed; exterior: band of outlined solid tongues above band of broken maeander.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the exterior decoration, see British Museum 1924,1201.486.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0126) (phase 2)
